articles.headline: Unlocking Cancer's Weak Link: New Peptides Target GSK3β with ATP-Mimicry
articles.hook: Imagine designing a drug that outsmarts cancer by mimicking ATP—this research does just that, offering a blueprint for smarter therapies.
articles.difficulty: Sophomore (requires foundational chemistry, biochemistry, and organic chemistry knowledge).

articles.headline: Bromine Beats Fluorine: How Computer Modeling Boosts Solar Cell Efficiency
articles.hook: If you're building the future of renewable energy, this research shows how computer modeling can outsmart chemistry to power the next generation of solar cells.
articles.difficulty: **Sophomore**: Needs intro-level major courses (organic, physical chemistry, and materials science) to grasp the computational methods and molecular design concepts.
articles.source: Journal of the American Chemical Society
